Limited information Goodness-of-Fit tests

Haziq Jamil

Source: vignettes/ligof.Rmd
ligof.Rmd
library(plFA)
#> ℹ Loading required package: lavaan
#> This is lavaan 0.6-19
#> lavaan is FREE software! Please report any bugs.
#> 
#> ── Conflicts ───────────────────────────────────────────────────── plFA 0.1.0 ──
#> ✖ plFA::cfa() masks lavaan::cfa()
library(lavaan.bingof)
(dat <- gen_data_bin(n = 1000, seed = 123))
#> # A tibble: 1,000 × 5
#>    y1    y2    y3    y4    y5   
#>    <ord> <ord> <ord> <ord> <ord>
#>  1 1     0     0     1     1    
#>  2 1     1     1     1     1    
#>  3 1     1     1     0     1    
#>  4 1     1     0     1     1    
#>  5 1     1     0     1     1    
#>  6 1     1     1     1     1    
#>  7 1     1     1     1     0    
#>  8 1     1     1     1     1    
#>  9 1     1     1     1     1    
#> 10 1     0     0     1     1    
#> # ℹ 990 more rows
mod <- "eta =~ y1 + y2 + y3 + y4 + y5"
fit <- cfa(mod, dat, std.lv = TRUE)
tinytest::expect_true(inherits(fit, "plFAlavaan"))
#> ----- PASSED      : <-->
#>  call| tinytest::expect_true(inherits(fit, "plFAlavaan"))

# Test statistics
all_tests(fit)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 6
#>      X2    df name          pval Xi_rank     S
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <chr>        <dbl>   <int> <int>
#> 1 2.82   5    Wald         0.728      14    15
#> 2 2.80   5    WaldVCF      0.730       5    15
#> 3 0.862  3.31 WaldDiag,MM3 0.872      15    15
#> 4 1.86   3.63 Pearson,MM3  0.709      15    15
#> 5 2.30   4.18 RSS,MM3      0.707      15    15
#> 6 1.86   3.62 Multn,MM3    0.708      15    15

Most tests look fine, except the Wald and WaldDiag – both of which rely on the Ω2\Omega_2 matrix. Let’s do some checking.

Check first the probabilities and proportions.

x <- lavaan.bingof::get_uni_bi_moments(fit)  # plFA
y <- lavaan.bingof::get_uni_bi_moments(  # lavaan
  lavaan::cfa(mod, dat, std.lv = TRUE)
)  
tinytest::expect_equal(x, y, tolerance = 1e-4)
#> ----- PASSED      : <-->
#>  call| tinytest::expect_equal(x, y, tolerance = 1e-04)

Check the H−1H^{-1} matrix.

Hinv1 <- computeVar(fit@external$plFA, fit@external$D)$invH
Hinv2 <- lavaan.bingof:::get_sensitivity_inv_mat(fit)
tinytest::expect_equal(Hinv1, Hinv2)
#> ----- FAILED[data]: <-->
#>  call| tinytest::expect_equal(Hinv1, Hinv2)
#>  diff| Mean relative difference: 1.61476

# lavaan:::lav_model_hessian(
#     lavmodel = fit@Model,
#     lavsamplestats = fit@SampleStats,
#     lavdata = fit@Data,
#     lavoptions = fit@Options
# )

So both are off. I think we should check the PML fit using lavaan package first.

fit1 <- plFA::cfa(mod, dat, std.lv = TRUE)
fit2 <- lavaan::cfa(mod, dat, std.lv = TRUE, estimator = "PML")
tinytest::expect_equal(coef(fit1), coef(fit2), tolerance = 1e-5)
#> ----- PASSED      : <-->
#>  call| tinytest::expect_equal(coef(fit1), coef(fit2), tolerance = 1e-05)
tinytest::expect_equal(fit1@Fit@Sigma.hat, fit2@Fit@Sigma.hat, tolerance = 1e-5)
#> ----- PASSED      : <-->
#>  call| tinytest::expect_equal(fit1@Fit@Sigma.hat, fit2@Fit@Sigma.hat, 
#>  call| tolerance = 1e-05)

Test extracted lavaan stuff:

x <- lavaan.bingof:::extract_lavaan_info(fit1)
y <- lavaan.bingof:::extract_lavaan_info(fit2)
tinytest::expect_equal(x, y, tolerance = 1e-4)
#> ----- FAILED[data]: <-->
#>  call| tinytest::expect_equal(x, y, tolerance = 1e-04)
#>  diff| Component "lavoptions": Component "test": 1 string mismatch
#>  diff| Component "lavoptions": Component "optim.method": 1 string mismatch
#>  diff| Component "lavpartable": Component "se": Mean relative difference: 0.03419516

Differences in test statistic values.

c("Wald_test", "Wald_vcovf_test", "Wald_diag_test", "Pearson_test", "RSS_test", "Multn_test") |>
  purrr::set_names() |>
  purrr::map(.f = function(x) {
    out1 <- do.call(x, list(fit1))
    out2 <- do.call(x, list(fit2))
    tinytest::expect_equal(out1, out2, tolerance = 1e-2)
  })
#> $Wald_test
#> ----- PASSED      : <-->
#>  call| .f(.x[[i]], ...) 
#> 
#> $Wald_vcovf_test
#> ----- PASSED      : <-->
#>  call| .f(.x[[i]], ...) 
#> 
#> $Wald_diag_test
#> ----- PASSED      : <-->
#>  call| .f(.x[[i]], ...) 
#> 
#> $Pearson_test
#> ----- PASSED      : <-->
#>  call| .f(.x[[i]], ...) 
#> 
#> $RSS_test
#> ----- PASSED      : <-->
#>  call| .f(.x[[i]], ...) 
#> 
#> $Multn_test
#> ----- PASSED      : <-->
#>  call| .f(.x[[i]], ...)
